distribution.text: Copyright 2024 SUSE LLC. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
This update for vsftpd fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2021-3618: Enforced security checks against ALPACA attack (PM-3322, jsc#SLE-23895, bsc#1187686, bsc#1187678).
- Added hardening to systemd services (bsc#1181400).

Bugfixes:
- Fixed a seccomp failure in FIPS mode when SSL was enabled (bsc#1052900).
- Allowed wait4() to be called so that the broker can wait for its child processes (bsc#1021387).
- Fixed hang when using seccomp and syslog (bsc#971784).
- Allowed sendto() syscall when /dev/log support is enabled (bsc#786024).
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.text: ALPACA is an application layer protocol content confusion attack, exploiting TLS servers implementing different protocols but using compatible certificates, such as multi-domain or wildcard certificates. A MiTM attacker having access to victim's traffic at the TCP/IP layer can redirect traffic from one subdomain to another, resulting in a valid TLS session. This breaks the authentication of TLS and cross-protocol attacks may be possible where the behavior of one protocol service may compromise the other at the application layer.
notes.title: CVE description
